alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 10:55AM CDT until October 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Big Eau Pleine River near Stratford affecting Marathon County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Eau Pleine River near Stratford. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Flooding affects mainly agricultural land. Some cottages may be affected by water on the western end of the Big Eau Pleine Reservoir...or about 5 miles downstream of the gauge on Highway 97. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 15.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
